intro: Filago tenuifolia, commonly known as slender filago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces achenes as its seeds. Filago tenuifolia is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
